stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

stadium.name: The Old Fort
stadium.description: The team plays within the crumbling, stone-ringed ruins of an ancient hill-fort. The 'runes' are just old, weathered carvings on the standing stones that serve as obstacles.

stats.pregame_ritual: Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Spitting into their own hand and then slapping their face with it.
Reciting the names of legendary Trollball players of the past.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
A toast of goat's milk to the health of their rivals.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Patting every beast of burden they see on the way to the match.

Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Collecting a pebble from every field they've ever played on.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è Tuesday Night Trollball: Winners Bracket Showdown! üèüÔ∏è 

Greetings, boils and ghouls, and all you sports-starved souls trapped in the meat-grinder of Osterra! It is I, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the High-Pass Pitch for a playoff opener that‚Äôll make your teeth rattle! We are in the Winners Bracket, folks! Game 1 of a Best of 3 series where the stakes are higher than a Harpy's nest and the air is thinner than the patience of my boss, Lord Orzalon! Today, the Kerlauger Runeguard travel up the mountain to face the Oread's Summit Tamers, and let me tell you, the atmosphere is electric‚Äîmostly because of the lightning storms!

Look at the sidelines, folks! I see Shepperd Trefler of the Runeguard braiding his hair into those battle-ready rows; he knows he's going to need every ounce of focus to avoid falling off this cliff! Meanwhile, over in the Tamers' camp, Saloma Talich is getting the traditional shoulder punch to get the blood pumping. Talk about a warm-up! You can really feel the playoff tension. Even though the stands are a bit quiet‚Äîmaybe the fans are still recovering from one of Imra's elixirs or got lost in the fog back at the Old Fort‚Äîthe players are ready to tear each other limb from limb!

We're playing at the High-Pass Pitch today, and boy, that altitude is no joke! I saw Kython and his fey circus trying to juggle earlier, and they looked more green than a Swamp Troll. Between the vertigo and the threat of a sudden blizzard, these players aren't just fighting each other; they're fighting the very ground beneath them! It‚Äôs a beautiful day for some organized chaos, and I can't wait to see who gets sent to the loser's bracket and who takes a step toward glory! Let's get to the action!
postGame:
# üèÜ Post-Game Report: Tamers Tame the Guard! üèîÔ∏è

What a display of pure, unadulterated violence we just witnessed! The Oread's Summit Tamers have defended their mountain home with a 6-2 victory over the Kerlauger Runeguard, taking a commanding lead in this Best of 3 series! The thin air certainly favored the locals today, as the Runeguard looked like they were breathing through wet wool by the second half. It was a clinic in how to use the environment to your advantage, and I haven't seen this much falling over since the last time Sir Tanos tried to read a map!

The match started with a bang as Saloma Talich scooped up the troll head in Center Field. After a bit of a scuffle, Saloma didn't bother running into the end zone‚Äîno sir! They went for the glory and nailed a Shoot from Center Field to put the Tamers up by 2! The home crowd‚Äîor the three mountain goats watching‚Äîwent wild! The Runeguard tried to answer back, but Alwyn Wandy decided that Vivia Namara‚Äôs face looked better horizontal, delivering an injury that sent Vivia straight to the sidelines early on!

Possession was a nightmare for both sides in the first half! We saw drops from Shepperd Trefler and Reginauld Cordell that I can only attribute to the vertigo-inducing heights of the Pitch. Gurney Fadiman tried to keep the Runeguard in it, but the Tamers' defense was like a stone wall. Just before the half, Saloma Talich was at it again, this time putting Harilda Sigsmond out of commission with a tackle that sounded like a dry branch snapping! Pure music to my ears, folks!

Halftime gave everyone a chance to breathe, and Carn Tibbetts worked some minor miracles to get the injured back on the field. But as soon as the whistle blew for the second half, Lon Gabriell of the Runeguard showed some life! Lon stepped up and sunk a massive Shoot from the Home Field, tying things up at 2-2! For a moment, it looked like we had a real barn-burner on our hands, but the Tamers weren't about to let their lead slip away on their own turf.

Mitran Mariand picked up the ball for the Tamers, but Shepperd Trefler‚Äîthe man with the braids‚Äîcame in like a wrecking ball and sent Mitran to the healer‚Äôs tent! However, the Tamers didn't blink. Odericus Juxon took advantage of the chaos, found an opening in Center Field, and fired another Shoot straight through the goal! The Tamers regained the lead 4-2, and you could see the spirit leaving the Runeguard faster than a soul escaping a White Raven's 'justice.'

The Runeguard's offense completely crumbled under the pressure. Johnna Beetner and Lon Gabriell both missed crucial shots that could have narrowed the gap. Meanwhile, the Tamers were playing keep-away with the troll head. Swamy Ahasuerus showed off some incredible range, launching a Shoot from the Away Field that sailed through the air like a disgruntled griffon, bringing the score to a dominant 6-2!

In the final minutes, the Runeguard tried a desperate passing game, but it was a disaster! Johnna Beetner‚Äôs pass was snatched right out of the air by Zadoc Wyatan! Not to be outdone, Kass Fogel‚Äôs subsequent wild pass was intercepted by Trefler, but the Runeguard just couldn't capitalize. The frustration was visible, and that's when the real playoff brutality kicked in for the closing ceremonies!

Zadoc Wyatan, perhaps annoyed by the Runeguard's persistence, absolutely leveled Reginauld Cordell, leaving him in a heap. And if that wasn't enough, Alwyn Wandy‚Äîmy player of the game for pure meanness‚Äîdecided Johnna Beetner needed a nap, delivering a crushing blow that ended the match on a high note of carnage! The Runeguard players were dropping like flies, and the Tamers were standing tall on the peak!

Final score: The Oread's Summit Tamers 6, The Kerlauger Runeguard 2. The Tamers are just one win away from advancing in the Winners Bracket, while the Runeguard need to find some oxygen and a lot of luck if they want to survive Game 2! Dame Terra Monteforte is going to have some choice words for her squad after this performance, and I hope they're as sharp as the Katars they're carrying!

That's all from the High-Pass Pitch! I'm Nok the Corrupter, wishing you all a night of pleasant nightmares and even better Trollball! Stay brutal, Osterra!
